news_header: A super-typhoon hit eastern Taiwan with 10-meter waves and strong winds, causing closures and damage.
news_text: A super-typhoon, designated Kong-rey, struck the eastern coast of Taiwan, bringing 10-meter high waves and winds reaching 51 meters per second. Schools, offices, and businesses were closed as thousands evacuated. The storm caused significant damage, including fallen trees and mudslides, resulting in one death and 73 injuries. The storm is compared to the powerful Gaemi typhoon from July, which was the strongest in eight years.
